solution_line_template: The {dogs_video_games_percent_num}% of the class that chose dogs and video games amounts to {total_students}*{dogs_video_games_percent_decimal} = <<{dogs_video_games_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{total_students}={students_dogs_video_games}>>{students_dogs_video_games} students who prefer dogs over cats.

Similarly, the {dogs_movies_percent_num}% that chose dogs and movies amount to {total_students}*{dogs_movies_percent_decimal} = <<{total_students}*{dogs_movies_percent_decimal}={students_dogs_movies}>>{students_dogs_movies} students who prefer dogs over cats.

Because these are the only two ways that a student could indicate their preference for dogs, and because these groups do not overlap, a total of {students_dogs_video_games} + {students_dogs_movies} = <<{students_dogs_video_games}+{students_dogs_movies}={total_students_prefer_dogs}>>{total_students_prefer_dogs} students favor dogs over cats in this teacher's class.
